result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur.
4/22/19 Probation is extended for 2 yrs from 9/24/19 to 9/24/21, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Joint & Several w/ co-def. To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SC and his family.

Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 for cts 3 & 4 only upon successful completion of probation with no ATR's, complete pmt of restitution & crt ordered financial obligations & no new arrests rising to the level of probably cause.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

bail amended to $5,000 cash bail; referred to BMP

$5,000 cash bail
If defendant posts bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM.  If defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 am on the business day following his/her release from jail.  Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
If defendant should fail to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for defendant's arrest and defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant shall have no contact, direct or indirect, with Teresa M located on the 800 block of Troy Dr, Hozia N located on the 800 block of Troy Dr, Karen M located on the 600 block of Troy Dr, Stephen S located on the 500 block of Nova Way, Sondi G located on the 3400 block of Holland Rd, Scott K located on the 800 block of Woodward Dr, Scott C located on the 900 block of Woodward Dr, Stephen L located on the 4600 block of Kennedy Rd, Troy McI located on the 4600 block of Kennedy Rd, Tianna M located on the 4600 block of Kennedy Rd, Jenna L located on the 1800 block of Sheridan Dr and Matthew N located on the 3400 block of Harper Rd.

Defendant shall not use of possess any amount of alcohol.
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior written approval of the court.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case, on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM) by 10:00 am on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring , cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,500.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.  If defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM.  If defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 am on the business day following his/her release from jail.  Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
